solution_line_template: If two pizzas will be delivered at two of the stops, the total number of stops will be {initial_potential_stops}-{stops_consolidated}=<<{initial_potential_stops}-{stops_consolidated}={total_stops}>>{total_stops} stops.

If there are {total_stops} stops in {total_delivery_time} minutes, then the delivery person needs to average {total_delivery_time}/{total_stops}=<<{total_delivery_time}/{total_stops}={minutes_per_stop_average}>>{minutes_per_stop_average} minutes per stop.
